name: Beach Breeze Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only able to stay one nite but wished it had been more. We had one of the corner rooms with the fireplace & it was the perfect setting to watch the tides. Don was great with advice & answered all our questions patiently. We are already planning another trip & def will be spending more than one nite here.
reviews.title: Great stay.

reviews.text: What a great place to stay! Comfy and rustic but clean, cute and cozy! Don and Patty, the owners are fabulous to deal with. We brought some wood and enjoyed the chiminea at sunset and the indoor fireplace later on. Everything we needed (aside from some board games) was available. The community rec centre across the parking lot had cheap ice cream cones and some snacks as well as arcade games and an ol' style but fun mini putt that we enjoyed with the kids. They even had "chocolate bar Bingo". We walked the beach forever when the tide was out collecting pretty rocks and beach glass and enjoyed our touring around the valley.Started with a family round of golf at KenWo and finished off with a hike at Blomidon and a snooze on that beach. Great prices for the area and only an hour from Halifax
reviews.title: Watch the tides roll in and walk the mudflats forever

reviews.text: This little place was recommended by the tourist desk in Wolfville. When we arrived, we were made to feel at home. The owners were awesome. We even hung out with the other guests outside for a while. There is a huge heated pool outside and a great view of the bay. The room was very clean. There was a coffee maker, a fridge and a microwave. Our only complaint was that the shower ran cold too quickly. We spoke to the owners and they were planning on updating this. We would definately return to this cute little spot.
reviews.title: Excellent Spot

reviews.text: The Beach Breeze was the highlight of our trip. It's tucked away off the beaten path right on the ocean. The view is spectacular and the rooms are clean and functional. Don and Patsy treated us like family and were very accommodating to all our requests. We stayed in one of the smaller rooms but would book the larger room (extra cost) if we were staying longer. The larger rooms have windows right onto the ocean and include a sitting and bedroom area. Our room, while compact, still provided fridge, microwave, shower etc. and served our needs well. Not for people looking for luxury but a great place for people who want function and nature.
reviews.title: A real find! Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, nice pool...

reviews.text: We loved our four night stay at this motel. It has an excellant location with a view of the beach. We stayed in room number 5 on the end with a kitchenette and a sitting room with a view of the beach. It is very cozy and quaint and reminiscent of a cottage We had a campfire outside everynight under the stars. The motel does not sell wood so we bought a bundle from the campground but the wood is very wet and hard to start. We ended up buying some dryer wood at a local gas station. We had everything we needed in the room to make our stay enjoyable. The only thing that could be improved upon would be the little soaps that they leave in the bathrooms could be a little better quality. It was hard to get a lather out of them. We will definately go back if ever we are in the area again.
reviews.title: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach Breeze is in a special place with some of the most extreme tidal flows in the world. You can walk for miles along the tidal flats when the tide is out. Everything is well maintained & there are lots of spots to sit outside. We had one of the rooms facing the water with a kitchenette & the best views of the tides. The owners are wonderful people who will make you feel at home throughout your stay. Make sure & visit the Museum of Grand Pre which is close to the motel. And there are nice places to eat in nearby Wolfville. Beach Breeze is sure to put you in vacation mode.
reviews.title: Special place by amazingly low tides

likes.disliked: — Our room was not wheelchair accessible, but they may have others that are.

reviews.text: Great view! Quiet , comfortable and a very spacious unit #5 - the best! The fireplace had been started prior to our arrival so the viewing/sitting room was cozy for us. The owner made sure we had what we needed for a thoroughly pleasant stay of 3 days. Thank you Don & Patsy it was superb! The Sisters.
reviews.title: superb!

likes.liked: — spacious unit, fireplace, ocean front, view,
likes.disliked: — bath tub was a bit small

reviews.title: Great place to relax !!!
reviews.text: Great place to stay !!! Very nice, well cleaned rooms. Excellent

service. Very friendly staff, very accomadating and knowledgable of sites and attractions in the area. Really enjoyed the campfire at night. Was well rested and relaxed after stay. Also enjoyed the swim in the large well cleaned pool. Coffee in the morning was a treat also. Will come back again.
reviews.title: Loved It
Great Experience
reviews.text: My sister and I enjoyed a two night stay in July. This motel is so quaint. The room was very clean and comfortable. The owners were very helpful, giving us ideas of where to go and what to do. The view of the Bay of Fundy is awesome. The Beach Breeze Motel is a must if you are interested in the tide change. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about the Beach Breeze motel is the location and the delightful owners. As other posters have written, the view of Minas Basin is terrific --the difference between high and low tide is amazing. The motel sits atop a small bluff about 30 feet above the shoreline. It was very relaxing to simply sit and take in the beauty that others have described. We booked one of the two larger end units that included the sitting area - definitey worth the extra $20. The owners are super -- so friendly and helpful, without being overbearing. I also thought the overall cleanliness was good. The downside to the motel, in my opinion, is that it is very "tired," meaning that the motel itself is somewhat outdated. Our beds in particular were very uncomfortable. The mattress was very squeaky and reminded me of the old box spring mattresses in a college dorm. No amenities except for a tiny bar of soap - so be sure to bring your own shampoo and hair dryer. I would describe the experience as "high end camping." Yet for all these negatives, I would probably stay there again. There is something charming about the place, so if you book there with these understandings, you'll not be disappointed. While there, be sure to visit the Grand Pre Historic Site -- well worth it. We had dinner in nearby Wolfville at Rosie's on Main Street. Great food and reasonable prices. The mussels and fish and chips were terrific.
reviews.title: Loved it... but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While on a driving vacation in NS, we were looking for a place to stay in the Grand Pre / Wolfville area. We had originally planned to camp in Blomidon Provincial park. We took a look at tone of the rooms in the Beach Breeze motel because we liked the description in the Doers and Dreamers' Guide, and Donnie, one of the co-owners suggested we take a look at the park anyway, and come back if we decided to take the motel. We came back to the motel, and spent the night there. Although not a five star hotel room, we thought it was great value for money. We loved the location. The motel is by the shore, with a view of the tides on the Minas Basin. The large pool was great too for a morning swim ! The motel is close to the Grand Pre national historic site and the Wolfville area. Donnie and Patsy, the owners, are retired teachers, and are very nice people indeed. We enjoyed our stay !
reviews.title: Good memories of the Beach Breeze

reviews.text: My husband and I spent a wonderful 3 days here with our 3 and 5 year old boys. From reading earlier reviews we booked one of the waterfront rooms (5) which had a lounge area overlooking the tides. This was perfect for when the children went to sleep, we could pull the curtains across and sit and enjoy a glass of wine overlooking the sea.
reviews.title: Lovely Place

reviews.text: Don and Patsy are very friendly and helpful on the surrounding area. Wolfville is a beautiful town, the beaches are great for getting messy and the swimming pool at the motel is kept clean and inviting.
reviews.title: A motel with an exceptional waterfront location and great owners.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had everything we could want.. comfortable beds, clean room, friendly owners, beautiful veiws and shopping and eating out all nearby. Thanks for a great stay!
reviews.title: great little out of the way place

likes.liked: — the view, the cleanliness and cute rooms

reviews.text: I was in the area on business and had stopped at The Tourist Info in Wolfville. The were nice enough to call ahead, and at that time, there were only 2 rooms vacant in the couple motels in the area. I looked at the other first, then The Beach Breeze. When we seen the view, and met the owners, I was happy that I had pasted up the first place. I look forward to returning and staying here. It is an older motel, and could use some new beds, and a little more renovations. All in all, we enjoyed it very much. Our first night, most of the people that had rooms rented gathered out side and we all sat together watching the tide go out, and enjoyed a few glasses of wine. A very friendly feeling. Don the owner joined us for awhile also. Anything you needed, Don or Pasty went out of their way to help. We had only planned on staying one night, but ended up staying for 2.
reviews.title: Spectacular View, Super owners !

reviews.text: I'm sure that because I was there prior to the peak tourist traffic, it helped in the fact that Don was able to work a great room (with the best view of the Bay) with a reasonable rate. I may have not been so fortunate a month later when peak demand kicks in. No matter why, however, Don did make us feel more than welcome. He also was more than generous with his time in telling us where to get a great dinner in Wolfville. We got to see the tide shift right outside our windows. Pretty neat. And all of this extremely close to our tourist destinations in the Grand Pre area.
reviews.title: Don Boutilier was very accommodating to my needs and interest.

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights. Upgraded to the end unit rooms with a spectacular view. Well worth the extra $20. The kids were able to walk along the beach and look for rocks during low tide. Owners, Don and Patsy were super friendly. Motel is a little old and could use some updating, but all in all was very comfortable, clean, and affordable. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Spectacular view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night coming up from Halifax, about an hour drive - view of Minas Basin and tides simply amazing. We rented a deluxe room with kitchenette, adjoining room with fireplace and water view (only two rooms in this category) - amenities are basic (it is a motel, after all) but clean and spacious. Motel is adjacent to a public parking access point with some car traffic, but no real disturbance even on a Friday night. We prepared our own seafood feast, had a fire overlooking the water, and it was a night of pure relaxation and enjoyment. We will return next time we are in that part of Nova Scotia.
reviews.title: Spectacular view

reviews.text: We booked this motel because of the positive reviews we read at this site. But we were extremely disappointed by the quality of this motel. We did not stay in one of the larger rooms since we were just spending one night and didn't need a kitchen. Yes, the view is nice from the motel's location.. The owner was very nice and helpful, but the room was very basic with old beds with creaky uncomfortable mattresses. The sheets were thin and poor quality. The door to the unit only had poor quality lock with no deadbolt and we did not feel safe in this isolated location. The room was clean, but that is about the only positive aspect of the room. The overhead light flickered off and on and we were concerned about an electrical problem. The shower was horrendous! The showerhead was improperly installed and sprayed water all over the bathroom getting the towels and floors soaking wet. I've had better showers in campgrounds. We managed to get up early and get going just in the nick of time, as the power went out just as we were leaving the room. We paid $90 (Canadian) for this room and we don't feel that it was worth it. The owners need to do some serious upgrading. We do not recommend this motel in this condition.
reviews.title: Needs major updating!

description: We have beachfront/housekeeping rooms available. They offer two double beds (number 10 has a pull out hide- a-bed in the sun porch area ) and we can provide a cot. The beachfront/housekeeping room has a fully equipped kitchennette with a microwave, full fridge, coffee maker, full tub and shower and a fantastic view! The outer sun room area has a rustic slate stone floor, with lots of sitting area, large windows for the amazing view and a working wall to wall wood burning fireplace. We also have standard rooms available. They have two double beds,mini-fridge,coffee maker and a shower. All rooms have a view of the water
